sentences.en: a flag high atop a pole
sentences.cn: 高挂在旗杆顶端的旗子

sentences.en: Be careful! Don't jab his eye out with your bamboo pole.
sentences.cn: 小心! 你的竹竿别捅了他的眼睛.

sentences.en: He can carry 150 jin on a pole without straining himself.
He pushed the boat off with a shove of the pole.
sentences.cn: 他用篙一点就把船撑开了.

sentences.en: He shouldered the loaded carrying pole and walked off with a swing.
sentences.cn: 他挑起担子颤悠颤悠地走了.

sentences.en: Hoist the flag to the top of the pole.
I didn't want to be low man on the totem pole for ever.
Lash the piece of wood to the pole to make it longer.
sentences.cn: 把这块木头绑到那根竿子上使它更长些.

sentences.en: She is a pole dancer at London's famous Spearmint Rhino club.
sentences.cn: 她是伦敦著名的“薄荷犀牛”夜总会的钢管舞舞者。

sentences.en: She must have been up the pole to do such a thing.
sentences.cn: 她干这种事情准是发疯了.

sentences.en: taxes can be enough to &B{drive you up the pole}.
The acrobat balanced a long pole on his left shoulder.
sentences.cn: 杂技演员让一根长杆在他的左肩上保持平衡.

sentences.en: The conscientious researcher is careful to avoid up the pole and omission.
sentences.cn: 那位一丝不苟的研究人员总是小心谨慎地避免错误或疏漏.

sentences.en: the distance from pole to equator
The scientists will go on an expedition to the South Pole.
sentences.cn: 这些科学家们将要去南极考察.

sentences.en: The shoulder pole creaked under the weight of the luggage.
sentences.cn: 行李压得扁担嘎吱嘎吱直响.

sentences.en: The South Pole expedition proved to be staggeringly successful.
sentences.cn: 这次南极探险结果非常成功。

phrases.tran_cn: 电极；电杆；电力高压线杆
增长极；增长点；发展轴心

phrases.phrase: up the pole informal 非正式

trans.tran_en: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
to push a boat along in the water using a pole
